results.title: Marvin's room
results.creator_credit: Jerry Zaks, Robert De Niro, Jane Rosenthal, Scott Rudin, Tribeca Productions and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Bessie is a strong, sensitive and selfless middle-aged woman who has sacrificed her life to look after her ailing and bed-ridden father and slightly daft aunt. Her younger sister, Lee, shirked off such responsibilities, left home, married and had two children before divorcing. The marked differences between the two have meant that neither sister has been in contact for 20 years. But now Bessie has been diagnosed with leukemia, and her survival may depend on the sister she has long since erased from her life, or her two nephews whom she has never met. Cast includes: Diane Keaton, Meryl Streep, Robert De Niro, and Leonardo Di Caprio.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jerry Zaks, Robert De Niro, Jane Rosenthal, Scott Rudin, Tribeca Productions and Miramax Films

results.title: Once Upon a Cheese
results.creator_credit: John Richardson, Kestrel Film Productions and Hugh Stuckey
results.brief_description: A light-hearted look at the cheese industry in Australia today. Shows how cheese is made by a fully automated process. Points out that special factories have been set up to produce cheddar. Lists the different types of cheeses - all of which are now available in Australia. Touches upon the varieties to be used with wines and beer, in cooking and how to store cheese at home.

results.title: On Your Own (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Teach your children safety measures and self-care skills for times when they are home alone and show them how to confront their fears. The film stresses the need for communication between parent and child, and encourages children to view being alone as a positive, rewarding experience.

results.title: On your marks it's bright sparks. - Volume 2.
results.creator_credit: Mark Lamprell, Jeff Gale and Pru Donovan
results.brief_description: Planes, Trains, Boats and Cars: Sparky, Amy and Alex discover floating bikes, underwater boats, trucks without drivers, trains without trucks, cars that become boats and planes that become helicopters. But can Alex really turn his BMX bike into an excavator to drill a hole to China? “Water, Water, Everywhere”: Planet Earth should be called Planet Water says Sparky, as he flies Amy and Alex around the world to see why. From the Amazon River to the River Nile and even Antarctica, Amy and Alex see how water is a wonderful gift - to be used, enjoyed and shared by everyone.

results.title: Nil by mouth [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Gary Oldman, Douglas Urbanski, Luc Besson, SE8 and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This is a raw, unflinching look at a dysfunctional family as it copes with alcoholism, drug abuse, petty crime and domestic violence in South East London. Gary Oldman’s brilliantly written screen-play and stunning direction perfectly capture the solidarity, resilience and humour that make survival possible.

results.title: Nikkolina
results.creator_credit: Rebecca Yates, Glen Salzman, Learning Corporation of America and Cineflics
results.brief_description: Deals with the conflict of one’s own personal goals and one’s family by presenting a story about an American-born girl in a Greek immigrant family, and her resolution of the conflict between a skating event and a family wedding.

results.title: Nikita
results.creator_credit: Luc Besson, Jerome Chalou, Cecchi Gori Group Tiger Cinamatografica and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: Nikita (Anne Parillaud) is a junkie psychopath who gets life imprisonment for shooting a cop while she’s high on drugs. Whilst in prison she is given a second chance at life when she is asked to become an undercover agent for the French secret service. Within three years, after gruelling training, Nikita emerges as a superspy, a highly trained assassin, who kills effectively and emotionlessly until she falls in love … and then her world begins to crumble. Filmed with an adrenelin speed by Besson and shot in elegant colour by Thierry Arbogats, “Nikita” is a stylish thriller that breathed new life into the spy genre by its audacious use of style and art direction. From its tense beginning to the rivetting climax, “Nikita” is a non-stop rollercoaster.

results.title: Niki Lauda Explains Formula One
results.brief_description: World racing car champion, Niki Lauda, demonstrates the sheer speed and performance of Formula One driving. Historical footage is used to explore the sport’s development from early days to recent times, including how performance has improved and records are consistently broken. Driving his McLaren, Lauda shows his skills, while animation illustrates the finer technical points,. Designed not only for the general viewer but also the motor racing enthusiast. Rated: G

results.title: Cyberdelia
results.credit_line:
Steve Spangaro, director
Mike Collins, associate director
Milena Romanin, production manager
Susan King, interviews and research
Based on an original concept by Adem Jaffers
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description:
Cyberdelia is a visceral encounter with the aesthetic and ideals of Melbourne underground cyber artists at the confluence of analogue and digital creative practice in 1991.

In blending artist interviews and works, this magazine style documentary explores visions of personal and cultural enhancement through transformative digital technologies. The imminent fusion of spirituality with technology; flesh with machine and psychedelia with cybernetics is confidently proclaimed.

Cyberdelia is a visual and aural feast with the film-makers channelling the post-modern mischief and transcendental yearnings of the ‘cyberdelic’ movement to radical stylistic effect. Stunning cyber artist works are liberally leveraged as both feature material and interstitial fodder. Low-budget analogue video editing and compositing tools are pushed to the limit while artist on-camera interviews are staged in bizarre fashion so as to maintain the feel of a ‘trip documentary’ from start to finish.

Produced for broadcast on community television station RMITV, Cyberdelia stretches the boundaries of arts documentary to portray the brazen idealism and micro-processor powered creativity of these pre World Wide Web visionaries.

Artists: Acid Death Bed, Misha Hollenbach, Troy Innocent (Cyber Dada), Natalie Jeremijenko, Adem Jaffers (Neuro), Jeff Jaffers (Third Eye), Dale Nason (Cyber Dada), Ollie Olsen (Third Eye) Captain ROM, Stelarc, Gus Till (Third Eye), Julian Wong, Christopher Wright and Max Q.

Cyberdelia was generously donated to ACMI by Cyberdelia Productions.

results.title: Cyberthon IV: EPIC Omnicast (Psymmetry in Psyburbia)
results.brief_description:
Cyberthon-IV: EPIC Omnicast (Psymmetry in Psyburbia) was the fourth Cyberthon broadcast event in the Cyberthon series held during the Experimenta festival in 1994. Like the Cyberthon events before it, Cyberthon-IV: EPIC Omnicast was a collaborative, live broadcast featuring artists, performers, DV’s and VJ’s.

This event more than any other Cyberthon broadcast, employed a range of cutting-edge technologies to broaden its reach. Globall participation was fostered via emergent online platforms such as a bulletin board system (BBS), C.U-SeeMe videoconferencing and a multicast backbone (M-Bone) or virtual network. In a Melbourne, if not world first, use of these platforms allowed artists to connect and create with their audience while enthusiasm for experimental electronic music and art saw DV’s and VJ’s mixing audio and images simultaneously while also taking audience requests.

Visual Artists: Tekno Mandala (Adem Jaffers), Cyber Dada (Dale Nason and Troy Innocent), Don’t Shoot the Messenger (Steve Middleton and Attillio Gangemi)

Audio Artists: Voodoo Moon (Ollie Olsen and Arthur Arkin), Zen Paradox (Steve Law), Mystic Force (Russel Hancorne), Psyko Disko (Fred Disco), The Visitor (Andrew Till)

Performers: 3RRR radio host on Tranzmission (Kate Bathgate).

Cyberthon IV: EPIC Omnicast is part of the Cyberthon Archive generously donated to ACMI by Adem Jaffers.
